comments:
Build ID:  200609251014

Steps To Reproduce:
1. launch WID (please close and re-launch if it's already running)
2. enter workspace name: C:\gda-ws-1   << a new name.  
3. click on 'go to bi perspective' in top right corner of welcome
4. help > samples....
   find loan app (its hidden under application samples)
   import it (click on the import link)
5. wait for build to finish
6. project > clean
7. wait for build to finish
8. close WID 
10. open the error log file in the worskpace .metadata
directory (e.g. c:\gda-ws-1\.metadata\.log)
11. there will be 2 exceptions

I am setting the severity to major, because it this happens for 
the "out-of-the-box" sample application.

More information:
The first exception:

From the stack pieces it seems that the problem is related to either help system or WID setup so I am forwarding it for comment to the UA. 

(By the way, you specified that you are using Eclipse 3.0.2 ?)
From the stack trace it does look like this is a 3.0.x based platform.  Did we really build 3.0.x on 200609251014?  Can you reproduce on a later version of Eclipse?

I think it is Eclipse 3.0.2.5 
I'm getting the following info while clicking on org.eclipse.platform in Help>About>Feature Details

Eclipse Platform

Version: 3.0.2.5
Build id: 200609251014


I cannot reporduce it on a newer version of Eclipse, because WID uses 3.0.2 version only.

I am using WID 6.0.2, Build id: 6.0.2-20061204_1400
This problem does not exist in WID 6.0.1.2 version

Artur, is your product using (accidentally or intentionally) org.eclipse.tomcat and/or org.eclipse.help.appserver to host webapps? These are considered internal (non-API) and only meant to be used by help. Also, did you actually launch help during your session? If no, then it implies that someone is using them because those plug-ins should only be started if help is requested.

> These are considered internal (non-API) and only meant to be used by help. 
> Also, did you actually launch help during your session? 
>
Yes, I've open help to import the workspace. (step 4.)
